Class BookService

java.lang.Object
application.BookService
public class BookService extends Object
Service layer for managing books in the library system.

Acts as an intermediary between the presentation layer and the BookRepository. Provides operations to add new books and search for existing books by keyword. This class keeps the business logic decoupled from the persistence mechanism.

  • Constructor Details

    • BookService

      public BookService()
      Creates a BookService with no repository configured.

      Use setRepository(BookRepository) or the BookService(BookRepository) constructor to supply the repository before invoking other methods.

    • BookService

      public BookService(BookRepository repository)
      Constructs a BookService with the specified repository.
      Parameters:
      repository - the BookRepository instance to use for storage and retrieval (may be null)

  • Method Details

    • addBook

      public Boolean addBook(Book book)
      Adds a new book to the repository after validating its required fields.
      Parameters:
      book - the Book object to add (validated for non-null title, author, and ISBN)
      Returns:
      true if the book was added; false if a book with the same ISBN already exists or validation fails; null if the provided book is null

    • removeBook

      public Boolean removeBook(Book book)
      Removes an existing book from the repository.
      Parameters:
      book - the Book to remove (its ISBN is validated)
      Returns:
      true if the book was removed; false if the book does not exist or validation fails; null if the provided book is null

    • getRepository

      public BookRepository getRepository()
      Returns the configured repository instance.
      Returns:
      the current BookRepository (may be null if not yet configured)

    • setRepository

      public void setRepository(BookRepository repository)
      Sets the repository used by this service.
      Parameters:
      repository - the BookRepository to use (must not be null to use search operations)

    • searchBooks

      public Book searchBooks(String keyword)
      Searches for the first book matching the given keyword in the title, author, or ISBN.
      Parameters:
      keyword - the keyword to search for
      Returns:
      the first matching book, or null if no match is found

    • search

      public List<Book> search(String keyword)
      Searches for books in the repository using the currently set search strategy.

      This method delegates the search to the BookRepository instance and returns a list of books matching the given keyword.

      Parameters:
      keyword - the keyword to search for (e.g., part of title, author, or ISBN)
      Returns:
      a list of books matching the keyword; empty if no books match
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no search strategy has been set in the repository

    • countBooks

      public int countBooks()
      Counts the total number of books tracked by the repository.
      Returns:
      the number of books currently stored

    • getAllBooks

      public List<Book> getAllBooks()
      Returns a snapshot of all books in the repository.
      Returns:
      list of all books (never null)
